The pepper-bark tree, Warburgia salutaris (Bertol.) Chiov. (Family Canellaceae) is one of the most widely used and traded medicinal plants in southern Africa
47 . This slow growing species is part of an early diverging group of basal angiosperms, thought to be native to eastern and southern Africa
48 . However, subsequent studies confined the distribution of W. salutaris to only a sub-region of southern Africa, i.e. South Africa
